task_summary: Detect the pink cloth, pinch-grasp its near edge, lift slightly, drag to fold onto itself, lower to crease, release, and retreat.

task_long_description.overview: A PR2 arm manipulates a pink cloth on a wooden tabletop. The goal is to create a single, neat fold by grasping one edge, performing a small lift to reduce friction, and pulling the grasped edge across the cloth before lowering to form a crease. The sequence emphasizes reliable perception, gentle grasping, and controlled end-effector motion. The robot should end with the cloth folded and the gripper open, clear of the workspace, while avoiding excessive forces that might shift the cloth unpredictably.
preconditions: Cloth visible on table and within reach
Camera pose provides unobstructed view of cloth
stepwise_plan: Verify the cloth is visible and detect it.
Open the gripper and approach above the cloth.
Align to the target edge, compute a pinch grasp, and pick.
Lift slightly and translate along the table to fold.
Lower until contact to crease, release the cloth, and retreat.
success_criteria: Cloth shows a clear single fold (double layer visible)
End-effector has retreated from the folded cloth
No significant cloth displacement from the intended folded position
failure_and_recovery: Perception failure: re-run detection and re-align
Grasp slip: reopen, recompute grasp, and retry pick
Insufficient fold: repeat the translate and lower steps
Over-dragging: retreat slightly and re-align before re-folding
task_long_description.termination: After releasing the cloth and retreating to a safe distance with no errors reported.

frame_3.now_evidence: Initial secure contact at the cloth edge is visible and the gripper is aligned for grasp.
frame_3.predicts_next: Subsequent lifting and dragging motions to fold the cloth are expected.

node_specs.description: Check that the cloth is currently visible.
Run detector to localize the cloth pose and edges.
Prepare for grasp with wide opening.
Move to a pregrasp height above the cloth.
Align TCP with the target edge.
Compute a pinch grasp on the cloth edge.
Execute the grasp to pinch the cloth edge.
Drag the grasped edge to fold the cloth.
Lower to press/crease the fold gently.
Back off to a safe distance.

failure_modes: Cloth not detected due to lighting or pose
Insufficient lowering fails to crease the fold
recovery_strategy: Short corrective translate in opposite direction
assumptions: Single fold is intended; no multi-step origami.
Dragging along +Y achieves the fold direction seen in frames.
Contact model allows gentle creasing with slow speed and low force threshold.

expected_success_criteria: No object in gripper after release
End effector outside immediate cloth area
